intro: Rubus sachalinensis var. diamantinus, commonly known as the diamond raspberry, is a variant of the raspberry species native to the Russian Far East and parts of northeastern China. It is characterized by its distinctive, shiny, diamond-shaped fruits that are typically bright red or orange-red in color. The plant produces compound leaves with serrated edges and has thorny stems typical of the Rubus genus. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. The berries are edible and have a tart flavor, making them popular in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
